adm:managed-object.name: network-group
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
is used to classify incoming client connections and route requests to workflows.

adm:relation.name: network-group-qos-policy
adm:relation.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the set of quality of service (QoS) policies enforced by the
.
adm:relation.adm:description:
All client connections belonging to the
will comply with its policies.

adm:property.name: enabled
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Indicates whether the
is enabled for use in the server.
adm:property.adm:description:
If a
is not enabled then its workflows will not be accessible when processing operations.

adm:property.name: priority
adm:property.adm:description:
A client connection is first compared against the
with the lowest priority. If the client connection does not match its connection criteria, then the client connection is compared against the
with next lowest priority, and so on. If no
is selected then the client connection is rejected.

adm:property.name: workflow
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies a set of workflows which should be accessible from this
.

adm:constraint.adm:synopsis: The referenced workflows must be enabled.

adm:property.name: allowed-auth-method
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies a set of allowed authorization methods that clients must use in order to establish connections to this .

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this property take effect immediately and do not interfere with connections that may have already been established.

adm:value.name: simple
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Clients who bind using simple authentication (name and password).

adm:value.name: sasl
adm:value.adm:synopsis: Clients who bind using SASL/external certificate based authentication.

adm:property.name: allowed-protocol
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies a set of allowed supported protocols that clients must use in order to establish connections to this .

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this property take effect immediately and do not interfere with connections that may have already been established.

adm:property.name: allowed-bind-dn
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies a set of bind DN patterns that determine the clients that are allowed to establish connections to this .
adm:property.adm:description: Valid bind DN filters are strings composed of zero or more wildcards. A double wildcard ** replaces one or more RDN components (as in uid=dmiller,**,dc=example,dc=com). A simple wildcard * replaces either a whole RDN, or a whole type, or a value substring (as in uid=bj*,ou=people,dc=example,dc=com).

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this property take effect immediately and do not interfere with connections that may have already been established.

adm:property.name: is-security-mandatory
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies whether or not a secured client connection is required in order for clients to establish connections to this .

adm:none.adm:synopsis: Changes to this property take effect immediately and do not interfere with connections that may have already been established.
